landingPage.firstParagraph: FeliX is a save file visualizer for the game Satisfactory. Open the .sav file and you can view a low poly 3D representation of your factory and the surrounding area. The save file is processed in your browser and not uploaded to a server.
landingPage.secondParagraph: FeliX also has some basic editing capabilities. It can convert the .sav format to a human-readable .json format. You can edit the .json file externally and then open it in FeliX to convert it back to a .sav file:
landingPage.thirdParagraph: The source code for this application is available on {github}. We are happy about any contributions. The low poly models were created by the respective {authors}.

openPage.title: Open save file
openPage.dragJson: Drag your JSON file here to begin or click to browse
openPage.dragSav: Drag your save file here to begin or click to browse
openPage.errorText: Please send this save file to me {dropbox} or per Mail to {mail} so that I can fix this.

settings.farPlaneHelp: How far away you can see objects
settings.conveyorBeltResolutionHelp: High values can cause very low framerate

open.title: Open save file
open.content: Do you really want to open a new save file and lose any changes in the current one?

save.title: Save save file
save.content: Do you want to download this save as a .sav file?

openJson.title: Import JSON file
openJson.content: Do you really want to import a JSON file and lose any changes in the current one?

saveJson.title: Export JSON file
saveJson.content: Do you want to export this save as a JSON file?

help.title: Help
help.controlsText:
Middle mouse pressed: move
Right mouse: rotate
Scroll wheel: zoom
Left mouse: select objects
help.changeJsonWarning: If you change the JSON you need to save it before clicking anywhere in the scene, else it will be overwritten!

about.title: About
about.row1: FeliX is a save file visualizer for the game Satisfactory.
about.row2: You can view the source code and contribute to the development on {github}.
about.row3: The low-poly models used by FeliX were created by the respective {authors}.

delete.title: Delete object
delete.content: Do you really want to delete this object?
